channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Buy now, pay later provider Klarna says it filed confidentially for U.S. IPO
item.description: Klarna, which is known for its popular buy now, pay later business, has confidentially filed IPO documents with the U.S. SEC.

item.title: Saudi Arabia's Neom replaces its CEO amid reports of delays and cutbacks
item.description: Neom is set to host hyper-futuristic cityscapes and structures — but financial pressures on the kingdom are changing.

item.title: John Thune elected Senate majority leader
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump did not endorse a candidate to replace Sen. Mitch McConnell as the Republican caucus leader in the Senate.

item.title: Bitcoin climbs above $93,000 for the first time as investors digest postelection gains, inflation data
item.description: Bitcoin rose above $93,000 following slightly higher October inflation data Wednesday.

item.title: Trump tariffs — and possible exemptions — could provide opportunities for Britain
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump's proposed trade tariffs could prove boon for the U.K., with analysts pointing to potential exemptions, economic upswings and the likely resumption of trade deal talks.

item.title: Personal luxury goods market to shrink for first time since the 2008 financial crash, research finds
item.description: The personal luxury goods market looks set to face its first slowdown since the Global Financial Crisis, excluding the Covid period, a new report showed Wednesday.

item.title: Annual inflation rate hit 2.6% in October, meeting expectations
item.description: The consumer price index was expected to increase 0.2% in October and show a 2.6% 12-month rate.

item.title: This Australian quit her job at 24 and started a business out of her parents' garage—now, it brings in over $100 million a year
item.description: Jane Lu is the founder and CEO of online fashion retailer Showpo. Today, the business brings in over $100 million a year.

item.title: 'Many dark times': How this startup founder overcame self-doubt and started a $100-million-a-year business
item.description: Jeffrey Tiong, the founder and CEO of Patsnap, a IP and R&D intelligence startup, says an investor once told him he was "not fit to be CEO."

item.title: Business leaders weigh the U.S.' role in climate policy as Trump transitions to White House
item.description: Business leaders at the U.N. climate conference weighed the outlook for U.S. climate policy, as Washington transitions to Donald Trump's second term.

item.title: Liberty Media to spin off assets; CEO Greg Maffei to step down at year-end
item.description: Chairman John Malone will become interim CEO of Liberty Media. Liberty Media's investor day is set to take place on Thursday in Manhattan.

item.title: Denmark launches landmark framework for using AI under EU rules — with Microsoft backing
item.description: Denmark unveiled a blueprint on how to use generative AI in the corporate world to help firms get into compliance with strict new regulation from the EU.

item.title: China is catching up with the West on tech, Microsoft president says
item.description: According to Microsoft's web page about its presence in China, the company has operated there since 1992.

item.title: Mortgage demand stalls as financial markets digest Trump presidency
item.description: While tiny, the week's increase in total application volume marked the first rise in overall demand in seven weeks.

item.title: Tencent posts better-than-expected 47% profit surge as games, AI tools shine
item.description: Chinese gaming and social media giant Tencent on Wednesday reported profit above analysts' expectations, while revenue missed slightly.

item.title: Oil could plunge to $40 in 2025 if OPEC unwinds voluntary production cuts, analysts say
item.description: Many market watchers predicted a bearish year ahead for crude.

item.title: Dogecoin spikes after Trump announces a Department of Government Efficiency — DOGE
item.description: Dogecoin shot higher on Tuesday night after President-elect Donald Trump formally announced the creation of the Department of Government Efficiency.

item.title: Startup CEO says humans won't be needed for translation in 3 years as it launches AI app
item.description: Unbabel on Wednesday announced an artificial intelligence-powered translation service, adding another rival to a highly competitive space.

item.title: SoftBank-backed Swiggy's shares soar 15% on India market debut after stellar IPO
item.description: The company's IPO, the country's second-largest this year, was reportedly oversubscribed more than three times.

item.title: Japan is ramping up efforts to revive its once dominant chip industry
item.description: Japan has announced its latest plan to boost the country's chip and AI industries as it works to regain its leading position in semiconductor technology.

item.title: Australia plans to ban social media for under 16s — and experts have called it a ‘momentous step’
item.description: One expert says Australia is "on the verge of reclaiming childhood after it had been stolen for 15 years."

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Postelection euphoria takes a breather
item.description: Asia markets also tracked the fall in U.S. markets, with South Korea's Kospi leading losses.

item.title: Meta slashes EU Facebook and Instagram subscription fees by 40% to meet regional regulatory demands
item.description: Meta cut the price of its ad-free subscription versions of Facebook and Instagram by 40% for EU users to comply with regulatory demands in the region.

item.title: Bitcoin resumes its climb, briefly touching $90,000 in late afternoon trading
item.description: Bitcoin climbed over the $90,000 level in late afternoon trading Tuesday.

item.title: 'Everyone is calling': Trump's tariff threats send U.S. companies scrambling for lobbyists and loopholes
item.description: Donald Trump campaigned on hardline tariff proposals that alarmed economists, corporate America and Wall Street.

item.title: Elon Musk is no Kissinger, but may help improve U.S.-China relations, experts say
item.description: Musk's relationship with Trump has fueled expectations that he could soften U.S. policy toward Beijing, but experts caution against putting too much stock into the Tesla CEO.

item.title: Rivian-Volkswagen joint venture deal rises to up to $5.8 billion, VW cars expected as early as 2027
item.description: The companies said the deal is now up to $5.8 billion, with the first VW models to use Rivian's software and electrical architecture arriving as early as 2027.

item.title: A new luxury sleeper train is launching in England and Wales — here’s what a trip will cost
item.description: The LVMH-owned luxury hospitality company Belmond is launching a luxury sleeper train that will take travelers through the countryside of England and Wales.

item.title: Israel not in violation of U.S. law, but Gaza aid situation will be monitored: State Dept.
item.description: U.S. says there will be no major policy shift towards Israel at the end of 30-day deadline for improvement in humanitarian aid delivery to Gaza.

item.title: 'The market is right': Former Fed policymaker Mester sees fewer rate cuts next year after Trump's victory
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve could carry out fewer rate cuts than previously expected next year should President-elect Donald Trump's proposed global tariffs take hold, former Fed policymaker Loretta Mester said Tuesday.
